div.head: Paragraphs added: (element p)
div.p:
Paragraphs (p) may appear in various places in the description – essentially anywhere where there is not enough data for a structured description or where such a description is otherwise unnecessary or undesirable. A possible example might be paragraphs in the element condition, where different types of damage or loss could be grouped together, as in this example from the description of Codex Suprasliensis:
The beginning and the end of Ljubljana part are missing. Two leaves have been lost from the middle of the Vita of St Paul the Simple, after f. 86v. There are lacunae between ff.78v-79r, 84v-85r.
f. 38 (containing part of the Vita of SS Terentius, Africanus and Pompius) is bound in the wrong place and should be read after f. 88v.
The edges of the folia in the Ljubljana part were trimmed during the restoration of this part of the MS, with the result that the parts that are now in Saint Petersburg and Warsaw are slightly larger ( 313 250 )

div.head: Added: sourceDesc element
div.p: The sourceDesc element must not have a default attribute.

div.head: Added: status attribute
div.p: The status attribute is to be used only when the status is something other than "draft". That is
is okay, but no element can never have a status attribute with the value "draft".

div.head: Added: supportDesc element
div.p: The value of the material attribute on the supportDesc element cannot contain white space. Manuscripts written on a combination of parchment and paper should specify this value as "mixed" (not as "parchment and paper").

div.head: Added: teiHeader type attribute
div.p: The teiHeader must not have a type attribute. (In earlier files had a type atttribute with values like "text" and "sbornik", and those have now been removed.)

div.head: Added: textClass element
div.p: The textClass element must not have a default attribute.

div.head: Added: writtenLines attribute
div.p: The writtenLines attribute on the layout element takes a value of one integer or two white-space-separated integers. A single integer means that all pages have the same number of written lines; two integers defines the low and high values of the range of line counts. Where there are two values, they must be separated by white space; separating them with a hyphen or en dash is invalid.

div.head: Recommended minimum metadata content in manuscript description files for the Repertorium
The title and creator of the document
div.p:
This information comes at the beginning of the fileDesc:
Codex Suprasliensis: reading menaion for March, 10th century Maya Petrova- Taneva Anisava Miltenova
Andrej Bojadziev edition of XML code
...

The first part of the TEI file contains the titleStmt (i.e., title statement), which unifies information about the document title (title) and creators . In this example there are three types of creators: author, editor and the person who edited the XML code. Each of these creators is identified by the value of the xml:id attribute.

div.head: Information on document publication
div.p:
The second type of information deals with the publication of the document. It includes the name of the publisher, place and date of publishing, internal Repertorium identifier and availability (available, restricted, etc.). A sample of such information could look as follows:
e.g., Institute of Literature, BAS Sofia 1998 RC-MPCodexSuprasliensis
The intellectual content of this file is copyrighted by the creators under the Creative Commons Attribution-No Derivative Works 4.0 ...

New: The availability element must have a status attribute (typically with the value "free"), and it must not have a default attribute. For the usage of this element for the manuscript descrption see also Lost or destroyed manuscripts.

The Repertorium identifier is formed from the abbreviation RC, meaning Repertoium code, followed by an en dash, the first letters of the author’s (i.e., encoder’s) name, and an abbreviation of the repository and shelfmark. When the manuscript has a special name or is divided into several repositories, a unique name is used.

The content of the works in the Repertorium are published under a Creative Commons license that allows users to share (to copy, distribute and transmit the work) under the condition that they must attribute the work in appropriate way and may not alter, transform, or build upon it. This license is valid for the content written by the researchers. For TEI licensing and citation guidelines for software and text materials users may consult the TEI: Licensing and Citation part of TEI Guidelines. The XML additions and changes to the TEI models are governed by that same policy.
New: The availability element must have a status attribute (typically with the value "free"), and it must not have a default attribute.

div.head: The source of the document
div.p:
The last part of the fileDesc element deals with sources. In the case of a manu- script description that is intended to serve as the sole content of the electronic file, this information may be very brief. A thorough explanation of the sources for the description could then be part of the recordHist element in the administrative part of the file (adminInfo ). A short example of a bibliographic reference could be:
Заимов, Капалдо 1982

If, however, the description is to be accompanied by an edition of the manuscript text, then the sourceDesc should contain all elements of the description, begin- ning with the msDesc. In that case the edited text of the manuscript would consti- tute the body of the document:
...
... ...
...

div.head: Non-bibliographic aspects of the document
div.p: This information forms part of the profileDesc element (TEI Consortium:profileDesc). Here the following aspects are encoded:

list.item: exact date of the first document edition (day, month and year);
language usage in the document;
classification of the described text.

div.p:
The following example illustrates the use of these characteristics:
19.12.1998 Sofia
Old Slavic Bulgarian English
Reading menaion for March
March
Menologion
Vitae
Homilies
Changed incorrect ident values: ch to cu and bu to bg

The creation (date and place) information is for internal usage. The form of the date as part of the attribute is given as the sequence yyyy-mm-dd (year-month-day). Most of the files in the Repertorium are in Bulgarian, English and Old Bulgarian (Old Slavic, Old Church Slavonic). Latin is also used widely, especially in some manuscript names, e.g., Codex Zographensis. In this place in the description it is encoded as:
Latin

The Repertorium uses its own metadata scheme for metadata, encoded with
The metadata itself is always represented as a list of keywords. Added: Cf. the example above.

div.head: Descriptions of possible document changes
div.p:
Changes or revisions are recorded as part of the element revisionDesc. Each change is documented separately, starting with the most recent, e.g.:
Conversion to new Repertorium scheme. Included head element and its content. Small edtorial changes. Rearanged revisionDesc: now the last change comes to the first place. Removed constructions <author>anonumous</author> Added copyright statement Added Repertorium Identifier Proofreading

Here the value of the attribute who points to one of the content creators identified elsewhere. The date in the attribute is in year-month-day format. This list of revisions is intended to reflect primarily the technical side of the document. The documentation of editorial changes of a manuscript description might more properly be encoded in the recordHist as part of the administrative information (adminInfo).

div.head: Romanization
div.p: Romanization (the transliteration of Cyrillic into Latin characters) follows the "international scientific" system, documented at Romanization (transliteration of Cyrillic into Latin characters) (mirrored from ).

div.head: Superscription
div.p: Superscription in the early Repertorium files was encoded in at least four different ways, two using markup (the c and seg elements) and two using pseudo-markup (surrounding the superscript character with slashes or parentheses, e.g., "е/с/" or "е(с)" for ес. The only correct way of encoding superscription is with <seg rend="sup">, e.g., as "е<seg rend="sup">с</seg>". That is, use seg, and not c, to mark up a superscript character. Parentheses and slashes are never to be used in incipita and other transcribed text, whether to represent superscription or for other purposes. The only raw text that can appear in these transcription elements is text that occurs literally in the manuscript, and all editorial annotation must be represented with markup.

div.head: Types of Books
div.p: Use the terms in bold below to represent the types of books described beside them. We follow the usage of the Oxford dictionary of Byzantium where possible, which, among other things, means that we favor Greek spellings (e.g., Praxapostolos) over Latinized ones (Praxapostolus).

list.item: Gospel book instead of tetraevangelion
Lectionary instead of aprakos gospel
Praxapostolos instead of lectionary Acts and Epistles

div.head: When should a holy person be labeled as a saint?
div.p: Holy persons are not labeled as saints when their names appear as authors of texts. For example, the authoritative title for Clement of Ohrid’s "Sermon before receiving holy communion" is "Поучение преди причастие от Климент Охридски" (not "… от св. Климент …").

Holy persons are labeled as saints when they appear otherwise than as authors. For example, the authoritative title of the "Akathist hymn in honor of St. John the Baptist" is "Акатист за св. Йоан Кръстител" (not "Акатист за Йоан …", without the "св."). The only exception is that the word "Богородица" is never preceded by "св.".

The label for a saint is never repeated in texts dedicated to multiple saints. For example, "Служба за св. Пров, Тарах и Андроник и Козма Маюмски" uses "св." just once, before the first saint mentioned, and does not repeat it.

Where possible, we follow the Oxford Dictionary of Byzantium for names of persons, so "Gregory of Nazianzos" rather than "Gregory the Theologian". The Apostles are referred to as "St. Paul the Apostle". "Pseudo" names put the "pseudo" last in parentheses, so "Basil the Great (Pseudo)".

div.head: Conclusion
div.p: The Repertorium Initiative provides detailed, structured additions to the TEI XML manuscript description model. It complements the TEI model in some parts through the rearrangement of known elements, the addition of new ones, and the extension of the base of specialized attributes, all with an eye toward intra-project consistency and support for particular details of the Slavonic philological tradition.

div.head: Changes form the previous edition of Guidelines
Attribute class att.measurement.attributesin layout
div.p: Remove attribute class att.measurement.attributes from the content of element layout (unit,unitRef,quantity, and commodity). The special TEI attributes columns,streams,ruledLines, and writtenLines should be used instead.

div.head: Attribute usage in element material
div.p: Remove usage from the content of element material TEI has an function with the same meaning.

div.head: Attribute scriptin element scriptDesc
div.p: Remove attribute script in element scriptDesc. TEI has this attribute as part of the scriptNote so now this is the only place you can use it.

div.head: Value of subtypein element msName
div.p: When there are former individual names of the manuscript the value of attribute subtype is changed to former instead of previous old (See The Manuscript Name).

list.item: analysis – excluded are interp,interpGrp,span,spanGrp
certainty – excluded is respons
core – excluded are binaryObject,divGen,street,teiCorpus
header – excluded are appInfo,application,biblFull,namespace,samplingDecl,stdVals,styleDefDecl,tagUsage,tagsDecl,xenoData
linking – excluded are alt,altGrp,join,joinGrp,link,linkGrp
msdescription – excluded are handDesc,handNote,msItem,typeDesc,typeNote
namesdates – excluded are climate,langKnowledge,langKnown,listEvent,listNym,listOrg,nym,offset,population,sex,socecStatus,state,terrain
textstructure – excluded are div1,div2,div3,div4,div5,div6,div7
transcr – excluded are listTranspose,surface,surfaceGrp,metamark,handNotes,handNote,zone

div.head: Deleted TEI models
div.p: The Repertorium uses a different model for physical description.

div.head: Element additions

cell.egXML: additions = ## (additions) contains a description of any significant additions found within a manuscript or other object, such as marginalia or other annotations. [10.7.2. Writing, Decoration, and Other Notations] element additions { macro.specialPara, att.typed.attributes, att.datable.attributes, att.msClass.attributes, att.global.attributes, empty }

additions = ## (additions) contains a description of any significant additions found within a manuscript or other object, such as marginalia or other annotations. [10.7.2. Writing, Decoration, and Other Notations] element additions { macro.specialPara, att.global.attributes, empty }

div.note: New: Repertorium adds type (att.typed.attributes), class (att.msClass.attributes) and attributes for dates (att.datable.attributes) attribute in order to further characterize the additions in some way. att.datable.attributes add attributes like when,to, and from.

cell.egXML: altIdentifier = ## (alternative identifier) contains an alternative or former structured identifier used for a manuscript or other object, such as a former catalogue number. [10.4. The Manuscript Identifier] element altIdentifier { (msName*, placeName?, bloc?, country?, region?, settlement?, district?, geogName?, institution?, repository?, collection?, idno?, note?, altIdentifier*), att.global.attributes, att.typed.attributes, att.datable.attributes, empty }

altIdentifier = ## (alternative identifier) contains an alternative or former structured identifier used for a manuscript or other object, such as a former catalogue number. [10.4. The Manuscript Identifier] element altIdentifier { (placeName?, bloc?, country?, region?, settlement?, district?, geogName?, institution?, repository?, collection?, idno, note?), att.global.attributes, att.typed.attributes, att.datable.attributes, empty }

list.item: Includes msName to allow naming a separate sections or parts of the manuscript;
Makes idno optional element in order to use as identifier other designation, e.g. msName.

div.head: Element binding

cell.egXML: binding = ## (binding) contains a description of one binding, i.e. type of covering, boards, etc. applied to a manuscript or other object. [10.7.3.1. Binding Descriptions] element binding { (model.pLike | bindingNote | condition | decoNote)+, att.global.attributes, att.datable.attributes, ## (contemporary) specifies whether or not the binding is contemporary with the majority of its contents attribute contemporary { xsd:boolean | ( ## "unknown" | ## "inapplicable") }?, empty }

binding = ## (binding) contains a description of one binding, i.e. type of covering, boards, etc. applied to a manuscript or other object. [10.7.3.1. Binding Descriptions] element binding { (model.pLike | condition | decoNote)+, att.global.attributes, att.datable.attributes, ## (contemporary) specifies whether or not the binding is contemporary with the majority of its contents attribute contemporary { xsd:boolean | ( ## "unknown" | ## "inapplicable") }?, empty }

div.p: Includes element bindingNote with specialized features not necessarily related to decorative parts of the binding.

div.head: Element collation

cell.egXML: collation = ## (collation) contains a description of how the leaves, bifolia, or similar objects are physically arranged. [10.7.1. Object Description] element collation { (macro.specialPara | (summary?, quire*, signatures?, catchwords?, gregoryRule?, ruling?, pricking?)), att.global.attributes, empty }

collation = ## (collation) contains a description of how the leaves, bifolia, or similar objects are physically arranged. [10.7.1. Object Description] element collation { macro.specialPara, att.global.attributes, empty }

div.p: Instead of unstructured elements on paragraph level provides several more specialized sections, such as quire for description of each quire, gregoryRule,ruling and pricking.New: Elements signatures and catchwords should be used only here and not as part of model.pPart.msdesc since they are part of the characteristics of quires. So now you can have both a description of all features of collation and/or description of each quire.

div.head: Element colophon

cell.egXML: colophon = ## (colophon) contains the colophon of an item: that is, a statement providing information regarding the date, place, agency, or reason for production of the manuscript or other object. [10.6.1. The msItem and msItemStruct Elements] element colophon { (macro.phraseSeq | (model.headLike?, model.pLike*)), att.global.attributes, att.msExcerpt.attributes, empty }

colophon = ## (colophon) contains the colophon of an item: that is, a statement providing information regarding the date, place, agency, or reason for production of the manuscript or other object. [10.6.1. The msItem and msItemStruct Elements] element colophon { macro.phraseSeq, att.global.attributes, att.msExcerpt.attributes, empty }

div.p: New, From the Recent additions and changes to encoding guidelines and policies The TEI colophon element is phrase-like. Ours is div-like, which means that it contains one or more instances of p, optionally preceded by a single instance of head.

div.head: Element history

cell.egXML: history = ## (history) groups elements describing the full history of a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object. [10.8. History] element history { (model.pLike+ | (summary?, origin?, accMat*, provenance*, acquisition?)), att.global.attributes, empty }

history = ## (history) groups elements describing the full history of a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object. [10.8. History] element history { (model.pLike+ | (summary?, origin?, provenance*, acquisition?)), att.global.attributes, empty }

div.p: Includes element accMat in this place of the schema and removes it from the physDesc element. accMat (accompanying material) as described in the TEI P5 Guidelines is related with the manuscript history after its writing, unlike the element additions.

cell.egXML: msContents = ## (manuscript contents) describes the intellectual content of a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object either as a series of paragraphs or as a series of structured manuscript items. [10.6. Intellectual Content] element msContents { (model.pLike+ | (summary?, titlePage?, title?, author*, respStmt*, model.noteLike*, filiation*, textLang?, decoNote*, sampleText?, \div?, msItemStruct*)), att.global.attributes, att.msExcerpt.attributes, att.msClass.attributes, ## describes the type of the text attribute type { ## the text is original "original" | ## the text is compiled from various sources "compilation" | ## the text is translated "translation" }?, empty }

msContents = ## (manuscript contents) describes the intellectual content of a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object either as a series of paragraphs or as a series of structured manuscript items. [10.6. Intellectual Content] element msContents { (model.pLike+ | (summary?, textLang?, titlePage?, (msItem | msItemStruct)*)), att.global.attributes, att.msExcerpt.attributes, att.msClass.attributes, empty }

list.item: Changes the order of elements in some places to reflect the tradition in describing Slavonic manuscripts, e.g., title comes before author;
Includes respStmt for situations where these are need for clarification;
Remove unstructured description of items (msItem) keeping only the structured content (msItemStruct)
Includes sampleText to distinguish original text from the description;
Includes div element for the edition of rare or unknown texts;
Provides two more attributes (type and style) for compatibility with the old Repertorium schema.

div.head: Element msDesc

cell.egXML: msDesc = ## (manuscript description) contains a description of a single identifiable manuscript or other text-bearing object such as an early printed book. [10.1. Overview] element msDesc { (model.headLike*, msIdentifier, (model.pLike+ | (physDesc?, scribeDesc?, msContents?, history?, additional?, msPart*, msFrag*))), att.global.attributes, att.sortable.attributes, att.typed.attributes, att.declaring.attributes, att.docStatus.attributes, empty }

msDesc = ## (manuscript description) contains a description of a single identifiable manuscript or other text-bearing object such as an early printed book. [10.1. Overview] element msDesc { (msIdentifier, model.headLike*, (model.pLike+ | (msContents?, physDesc?, history?, additional?, (msPart* | msFrag*)))), att.global.attributes, att.sortable.attributes, att.typed.attributes, att.declaring.attributes, att.docStatus.attributes, empty }

div.p: Includes one more level of description for palaeographical and language features (scribeDesc). Moves model.headLike to the first position to serve as a heading of the description.

cell.egXML: msIdentifier = ## (manuscript identifier) contains the information required to identify the manuscript or similar object being described. [10.4. The Manuscript Identifier] element msIdentifier { (msName+, model.pLike*, placeName*, bloc*, country*, region*, settlement*, district*, geogName*, institution?, repository?, collection*, idno*, note*, altIdentifier*), att.global.attributes, empty }

msIdentifier = ## (manuscript identifier) contains the information required to identify the manuscript or similar object being described. [10.4. The Manuscript Identifier] element msIdentifier { ((placeName?, bloc?, country?, region?, settlement?, district?, geogName?, institution?, repository?, collection*, idno*), (msName | objectName | altIdentifier)*), att.global.attributes, empty }

list.item: Moving the element msName to the first place in the content;
Adding note to allow more specific information to appear here, e.g., bibliographic references.
New: Remove objectName from the content of the element.

div.head: Element msItemStruct

cell.egXML: msItemStruct = ## (structured manuscript item) contains a structured description for an individual work or item within the intellectual content of a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object. [10.6.1. The msItem and msItemStruct Elements] element msItemStruct { ((locus | locusGrp)?, (model.pLike+ | (title*, author*, date*, respStmt*, model.noteLike*, filiation*, textLang?, decoNote*, colophon*, (sampleText | \div)?, msItemStruct*, listBibl*, bibl*))), att.global.attributes, att.msExcerpt.attributes, att.msClass.attributes, ## describes the type of the text attribute type { ## the text is original "original" | ## the text is compiled from variuos sources "compilation" | ## the text is translated "translation" }?, empty }

msItemStruct = ## (structured manuscript item) contains a structured description for an individual work or item within the intellectual content of a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object. [10.6.1. The msItem and msItemStruct Elements] element msItemStruct { ((locus | locusGrp)?, (model.pLike+ | (author*, respStmt*, title*, rubric?, incipit?, msItemStruct*, explicit?, finalRubric?, colophon*, decoNote*, listBibl*, (bibl | biblStruct)*, filiation?, model.noteLike*, textLang?))), att.global.attributes, att.msExcerpt.attributes, att.msClass.attributes, empty }

div.p: The same changes as for the element msContents. Removed: Adds the element locusGrp since this is now part of the TEI model.

cell.egXML: msPart = ## (manuscript part) contains information about an originally distinct manuscript or part of a manuscript, which is now part of a composite manuscript. [10.10. Manuscript Parts] element msPart { ((altIdentifier | locus | locusGrp)*, model.headLike*, (model.pLike+ | (physDesc?, scribeDesc?, msContents?, history?, additional?, msPart*))), att.global.attributes, att.typed.attributes, empty }

msPart = ## (manuscript part) contains information about an originally distinct manuscript or part of a manuscript, which is now part of a composite manuscript. [10.10. Manuscript Parts] element msPart { (msIdentifier, model.headLike*, (model.pLike+ | (msContents?, physDesc?, history?, additional?, msPart*))), att.global.attributes, att.typed.attributes, empty }

list.item: Reflects the same changes as msDesc element;
Adds the locus and locusGrpelements for parts of the manuscript that are palimpsests or convolutes;
Removal: Adds the special attribute type.

div.head: Element musicNotation
div.p: Adds attributes type and subtype to allow typologization of the notation.

cell.egXML: physDesc = ## (physical description) contains a full physical description of a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object optionally subdivided using more specialized elements from the model.physDescPart class. [10.7. Physical Description] element physDesc { (model.pLike+ | (summary?, objectDesc?, ink?, decoDesc?, bindingDesc?, sealDesc?, additions*)), att.global.attributes, empty }

physDesc = ## (physical description) contains a full physical description of a manuscript, manuscript part, or other object optionally subdivided using more specialized elements from the model.physDescPart class. [10.7. Physical Description] element physDesc { (model.pLike*, objectDesc?, handDesc?, typeDesc?, scriptDesc?, musicNotation?, decoDesc?, additions?, bindingDesc?, sealDesc?, accMat?), att.global.attributes, empty }

list.item: Element accMat is moved to history;
The element ink is added.

div.head: Element scriptDesc

cell.egXML: scriptDesc = ## (script description) contains a description of the scripts used in a manuscript or other object. [10.7.2.1. Writing] element scriptDesc { (model.pLike+ | (summary?, scriptNote+)), att.global.attributes, empty }

div.head: Element supportDesc

cell.egXML: supportDesc = ## (support description) groups elements describing the physical support for the written part of a manuscript or other object. [10.7.1. Object Description] element supportDesc { (model.pLike+ | (support?, extent?, foliation*, pagination*, collation*, condition*)), att.global.attributes, ## (material) a short project-defined name for the material composing the majority of the support ## Suggested values include: 1] paper; 2] parch (parchment); 3] mixed attribute material { ## "paper" | ## (parchment) "parch" | ## "mixed" | xsd:token { pattern = "[^\p{C}\p{Z}]+" } }?, empty }

div.p: The element pagination is added.

cell.egXML: watermark = ## (watermark) contains a word or phrase describing a watermark or similar device. [10.3.3. Watermarks and Stamps] element watermark { macro.phraseSeq, att.global.attributes, empty }

list.item: Adds attribute class canonical with to allow usage of key and ref;
Adds new attribute tracing to characterize the way the watermark has been recorded;
Adds elements countermark and motif.

div.head: New elements
div.p: The Repertorium Initiative model introduces the following new elements in the TEI schema.

div.head: Element bindingNote
div.egXML: bindingNote = ## allows structured description of binding characteristics in addition to decoration and condition element re:bindingNote { (text | model.phrase | decoNote | condition)+, att.global.attributes, att.typed.attributes, att.damaged.attributes, empty }

div.head: Element countermark
Element crypto
div.egXML: crypto = ## contains a description of a cryptographic system used in a manuscript element re:crypto { macro.paraContent, att.global.attributes, att.typed.attributes, empty }

div.head: Element gregoryRule
Element ink
div.egXML: ink = ## contains a description of ink(s) used in manuscript element re:ink { macro.phraseSeq, att.global.attributes, att.measurement.attributes, empty }

div.head: Element langNote
div.egXML: langNote = ## allows structured description of language characteristics of the scribe element re:langNote { macro.specialPara, att.global.attributes, att.typed.attributes, att.datcat.attributes, att.canonical.attributes, empty }

div.head: Element motif
div.egXML: motif = ## (Watermark image type) contains information about a watermark motif element re:motif { (text | model.phrase | motif)*, att.global.attributes, att.typed.attributes, empty }

div.head: Element pagination
div.egXML: pagination = ## contains information about the pagination of the codex, separately from information about the foliation element re:pagination { macro.specialPara, att.global.attributes, att.scoping.attributes, empty }

div.head: Element pricking
Element quire
div.egXML: quire = ## contains information that describes a quire or set of quires element re:quire { (model.pLike+ | (summary?, locus?, locusGrp?, extent?, formula?, signatures?, catchwords?, gregoryRule?, ruling?, pricking?)), att.global.attributes, att.typed.attributes, ## describes the status of the quire or folia: original, added, missing attribute status { ## (Original quire is missing) "missing" | ## (New quire has been added) "added" | ## (Quire is original) "original" }?, empty }

div.head: Element ruling
Element sampleText
Element scribe
div.egXML: scribe = ## contains a description of the paleography, orthography, and language of a scribe element re:scribe { (locus | locusGrp)?, model.nameLike.agent?, scriptDesc*, scribeLang?, bibl*, note*, respStmt*, att.global.attributes, empty }

div.head: Element scribeDesc
div.egXML: scribeDesc = ## serves as a wrapper for elements, so that the characteristics of each scribe can be described separately, while also being bundled together element re:scribeDesc { (model.pLike+ | (summary?, scriptDesc?, scribeLang?, scribe*))?, att.global.attributes, empty }

div.head: Element scribeLang
div.egXML: scribeLang = ## contains a description of the orthography and language of the scribe element re:scribeLang { (model.pLike* | (summary?, langNote*)), att.global.attributes, att.typed.attributes, empty }
